newsitem.title: USA: Premark sees higher '97 capital spending.
newsitem.headline: Premark sees higher '97 capital spending.

text.p: Premark International Inc expects capital spending to be in a range of $80 million to $85 million in 1997, the comany said in its annual report.

The Deerfield, Ill.-based manufacturer said it spent $84.1 million in 1996, down from $85.7 million in 1995. It attributed the slight decrease last year to lower spending at its Wilsonart unit for laminate flooring plant equipment, mostly offset by additions at its Florida Tile and West Bend units.

President James Ringler, in a letter to shareholders, said Premark will focus on developing its brands in new channels and with new products, expanding its business internationally and cutting production costs.

The company said its Wilsonart business has strong growth potential. "The more than five billion square foot laminate market outside the United States represents a double-digit growth opportunity," it noted.
Wilsonart estimates it has about 49 percent of the U.S. sales of high pressure decorative laminates and about 20 percent of the U.S. sales of laminate flooring.
